str2: A primary preposition; 'fore', i.e. In front of, prior to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(act of) entering, an entrance, entry. From eis and hodos; an entrance.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To announce or preach beforehand, announce by herald. From pro and kerusso; to herald in advance.
The rite or ceremony of baptism. From baptizo; baptism.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
